title: All the WorldTour team bikes, tech and kit 2024
content:
Cyclist
All the WorldTour team bikes, tech and kit 2024

Despite Jumbo-Visma’s Grand Tour dominance, Specialized were the most successful bike brand in 2023, with its sponsorship of four WorldTour teams – including the force in women’s cycling SD Worx – paying off as they clocked up three more stage wins than Canyon, who had a strong Classics year thanks to Mathieu van der Poel.

With the 2024 season upon us down under, there are no more secrets about sponsor and aesthetic changes, and this year has seen an influx of switches.

Purists look away now, because in 2024 there isn’t a single WorldTour team using a Campagnolo groupset, with the final domino to fall the newly named Decathlon-AG2R, who have also switched bikes from BMC to Van Rysel. Other big changes include Groupama-FDJ and Lapierre splitting for the first time ever, SRAM taking on other big team after a huge 2023 and some bloody lovely paintjobs for Jayco-AlUla.

While there are no official new bikes out and about, winter training camps have seen a number of unreleased bikes and kit being leaked.

Related Posts

All the 2024 WorldTour kits ranked from worst to first

All the cycling tech leaked by the pros in 2024

Who actually are the pro cycling team sponsors 2024?

Men’s and women’s WorldTour team bikes 2024

Alpecin-Deceuninck and Fenix-Deceuninck

With Mathieu van der Poel and Jasper Philipsen, Canyon more than justified its sponsorship of Alpecin-Deceuninck and its women’s team Fenix-Deceuninck had a strong Tour de France Femmes in their first WorldTour season. We gave the Canyon Ultimate a 5-star review, and expect an update to the popular Aeroad this year.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad, Ultimate
  • Bottle cage: Elite
  • Clothing: Kalas
  • Computer: Wahoo
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Helmets: Abus
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Arkéa-B&B Hotels

They’ve switched Samsic for B&B Hotels, but Arkéa generally has the same-setup as 2023. The most notable change is switching from Shimano to Vision wheels.

  • Bike: Bianchi Specialissima, Oltre RC
  • Clothing: Ekoï
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebars/stem: Vision
  • Helmets: Ekoï
  • Saddle: Selle Italia 
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Vision

Astana Qazaqstan

They’ve got Mark Cavendish and they’ve got one of the prettiest bikes in the peloton, it could be a massive year for Astana. 

  • Bike: Wilier Filante SLR, Zero SLR, Turbine (see Cavendish’s custom TdF bike)
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Bottom bracket: Ceramic Speed BB86 
  • Clothing: Biemme
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmets: Limar
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade carbon 
  • Pulley: Ceramic Speed OSPW 
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch 2 
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Vision

Bahrain Victorious 

Bahrain Victorious’s Tour de France special edition white kit has become permanent for 2024, so the bike has too.

  • Bike: Merida Reacto Disc Team, Scultura Disc Team, Time Warp TT 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Handlebars/stem: FSA 
  • Helmet: Rudy Project
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch M5, Scratch M5 CPC, Dimension, Dimension Tri 
  • Seatpost: FSA
  • Sunglasses: Rudy Project
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Vision Metron SL 45 Disc and 60 Disc

Bora-Hansgrohe

Bora-Hansgrohe have made with switch from Shimano to SRAM for 2024, which may have something to do with new signing Primož Roglič, they’ve also abandoned their lovely Le Col kit for old flame Sportful, which definitely has something to do with Peter Sagan’s retirement.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Roubaix, Shiv TT Disc 
  • Bottle cage: Specialized 
  • Clothing: Sportful
  • Computer: Hammerhead Karoo 2 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red AXS
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz
  • Handlebars/stem: Roval Rapide
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: S-Works Power with Mirror 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo
  • Wheels: Roval CLX Rapide

Canyon-SRAM Racing

The Canyon-SRAM aesthetics are 10/10 and it looks like everything’s carried over from 2023.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad CFR, Canyon Ultimate, Canyon Speedmax TT
  • Clothing: Canyon
  • Computer: Hammerhead Karoo 2
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Helmet: Giro
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Ergon 
  • Shoes: Canyon?
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Schwalbe 
  • Wheels: Zipp

Cofidis

Cofidis will be riding these utterly lovely Look bikes in 2024.

  • Bike: Look
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Mobel
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 with Look cranks
  • Helmet: Ekoï
  • Pedals: Look 
  • Power meter: SRM
  • Saddle: Selle Italia 
  • Sunglasses: Ekoï
  • Tyres: Michelin 
  • Wheels: Corima MCC DX, WS Black DX, WS TT DX

Decathlon-AG2R

Swapping BMC for Decathlon’s Van Rysel branded bike, Decathlon-AG2R have gone through some big changes this off-season. They’ve even ditched Campagnolo for Shimano, leaving the Italians without a WorldTour representative.

  • Bike: Van Rysel RCR, XCR 
  • Clothing: Rosti
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebars/stem: Deda
  • Handlebar tape: Fizik
  • Helmets: Van Rysel CPR, FCR, XCR
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Ceramic, Ceramic Ti 
  • Saddle: Fizik
  • Sunglasses: Van Rysel
  • Tyres: Continental Grand-Prix 5000 S TR 
  • Wheels: Swiss Side Hadron 2 Ultimate 380/500/625

DSM-Firmenich-Post NL

Their riders might leave but their corporate and technological partners don’t. The Shimano sponsorship means it’s more than just a groupset for them here.

  • Bike: Scott Addict RC, Foil RC, Plasma 
  • Bottles and bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Nalini
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Helmet: Scott Cadence, Centric plus
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Syncros Tofino, Savona and Belcarra
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Driive
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro, Corsa Control, Speed
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace C36, C50, C60

EF Education-EasyPost

They’re undoubtedly the coolest team in the peloton, and officially have the best kit. The new paintjob isn’t bad either.

  • Bike: Cannondale SuperSix Evo, System Six, SuperSlice
  • Bottle cages: Elite
  • Bottles: Cannondale
  • Bottom bracket: Shimano BSA threaded
  • Clothing: Rapha
  • Computer: Wahoo  
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 with FSA crankset
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo Onetouch 2 and Onetouch 2 Gel
  • Handlebars/stem: Cannondale/Momo Design
  • Helmet: Poc
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay
  • Power meter: NG and NGeco PowerBox
  • Saddle: Prologo Dimension
  • Sunglasses: Poc
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa
  • Wheels: Vision Metron SL  

FDJ-Suez

Despite a slight name change, dropping Futuroscope as a title sponsor, the whole FDJ-Suez team will still be riding the Lapierre Xelius SL bikes like last season. 

  • Bike: Lapierre Aircode DRS, Xelius SL, Aérostorm DRS
  • Bottles and bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Helmet: Lazer
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Suglasses: Shimano
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Groupama-FDJ

It’s more obvious than ever that the men’s and women’s FDJ teams are separate entities, the men’s Groupama-FDJ team have split with Lapierre for the first time ever, bringing on these lovely Wilier bikes.

  • Bike: Lapierre Aircode DRS, Xelius SL, Aérostorm DRS
  • Bottle cage: Elite Leggero Carbon
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo
  • Helmet: Julbo
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo Scratch
  • Sunglasses: Julbo
  • Tyres: Continental Competition Pro LTD
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Human Powered Health

Human Powered Health have made a big switch from Felt to Factor bikes, and doesn’t it look glorious.

  • Bike: Factor Ostro VAM, O2 VAM 
  • Bottle cage: Arundel 
  • Clothing: Pactimo
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: SRAM Force eTap AXS 
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz 
  • Handlebars/stem: Black Inc
  • Helmet: Smith
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay 
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Tyres: Goodyear 
  • Wheels: Black Inc

Ineos Grenadiers 

Ineos Grenadiers haven’t changed much bar their colour scheme for their 2024 bike, but will be in new kit having switched from Bioracer to Gobik.

  • Bike: Pinarello Dogma F, Bolide F TT 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Most Ultragrip 
  • Handlebars/stem
  • Helmet: Kask Elemento, Utopia
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Sunglasses: SunGod
  • Tyres: Continental Grand-Prix 5000 S TR
  • Wheels: Shimano Dura-Ace

Intermarché-Circus-Wanty

While their kit isn’t to everyone’s taste, Intermarché’s Cube bikes and Newmen wheels look sensational.

  • Bike: Cube Litening Aero C:68X, Litening Air C:68X
  • Bottle cage: Elite Vico Carbon
  • Clothing: Verge
  • Computer: Bryton Rider S800
  • Crankset: Rotor
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmet: Uvex
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Carbon Ceramic Ti 
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Shoes: Gaerne
  • Sunglasses: Uvex
  • Tyres: Continental GP5000 S TR/TT TR
  • Wheels: Newmen Advanced SL R.42/R.65 Vonoa

Jayco-AlUla and Liv-AlUla-Jayco

Mostly colour changes for the GreenEdge teams with these contenders for the best paintjobs of the season. Liv Racing Xstra merging with the women’s team has added some colour boy has it paid off.

  • Bike: Giant TCR Advanced SL Disc, Propel Advanced SL Disc, Trinity Advanced Pro TT, Liv Langma Advanced Disc SL 
  • Bottle cage: Giant 
  • Clothing: Alé
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Helmet: Giant
  • Pedals: Shimano
  • Saddle: Giant, Cadex Boost 
  • Sunlasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Cadex 
  • Wheels: Cadex 36, 42, 65, Aero Disc, 4-Spoke 

Movistar

Movistar’s men’s and women’s teams are the same unit, so use the same stuff. That means Canyon, SRAM and Zipp lead the way. Look out for a new Aeroad in 2024.

  • Bike: Canyon Aeroad CFR, Canyon Ultimate, Speedmax CFR TT
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Gobik
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Handlebar tape: Lizard Skins 
  • Helmet: Abus
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Fizik Antares Versus Evo 00 
  • Shoes: Fizik
  • Sunglasses: 100%
  • Tyres: Continental 
  • Wheels: Zipp

Roland

After Israel-Premier Tech pulled out of the team it’s all change for Swiss team Roland, all we know so far is that they’ve switched Factor for Pinarello and will be in Q36.5 kit. 

  • Bike: Pinarello Dogma F
  • Clothing: Q36.5

SD Worx

It won’t come as a surprise that SD Worx’s sponsors remain unchanged for 2024.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Shiv TT 
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Clothing: Specialized
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Handlebars/stem: Roval Rapide
  • Helmet: Specialized
  • Pedals: Time 
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Specialized S-Works Power 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Sunglasses: Roka
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo 
  • Wheels: Roval Alpinist CLX (Zipp for TT bike)

Soudal-QuickStep and AG Insurance-Soudal

One of the most predictable in the peloton. It’s always going to be Specialized and Shimano here, barring something extraordinary, and Soudal-QuickStep and women’s team AG Insurance-Soudal have the same kit now.

  • Bike: Specialized S-Works Tarmac SL8, Roubaix SL8
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Bottom bracket: CeramicSpeed 
  • Clothing: Castelli
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 
  • Handlebar tape: Supacaz 
  • Helmet: Specialized
  • Pedals: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Power meter: Shimano Dura-Ace 
  • Saddle: Specialized S-Works Power with Mirror 
  • Shoes: Specialized
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Specialized Turbo Cotton 
  • Wheels: Roval Rapide CLX, Alpinist CLX, CLX 50, CLX 64, 321 Discs

Trek-Segafredo

‘F***ing SRAM.’ – Bauke Mollema, 2019. The least quiet launch of recent year’s came in the shape of the new Trek Madone SLR with a crazy looking hole in the seatpost. They added some crazy paintjobs for the Tour last year and look to be adding the whole to the Émonda soon.

  • Bike: Trek Émonda SLR 9, Madone SLR 9, Domane SLR 9, Speed Concept 
  • Clothing: Santini
  • Computer: Wahoo 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS 
  • Helmet: Trek
  • Pedals: Time
  • Power meter: Quarq 
  • Saddle: Bontrager Verse Pro
  • Shoes: Bontrager
  • Sunglasses: 100% 
  • Tyres: Pirelli P Zero Race
  • Wheels: Bontrager Aeolus RSL

UAE Team ADQ

UAE Team ADQ’s set-up is unchanged for 2024, and why would you want to change it?

  • Bike: Colnago V4Rs
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Pissei
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape: Prologo 
  • Helmet: Met
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Sunglasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Enve

UAE Team Emirates

UAE Team Emirates have the same sponsors as UAE Team ADQ with a slightly different paintjob, and expect those Enve wheels to be extra loud this year.

  • Bike: Colnago V4Rs, TT01 
  • Bottle cage: Elite 
  • Clothing: Pissei
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Handlebar tape:  Prologo 
  • Handlebars/stem: Enve
  • Helmet: Met
  • Pedals: Look Kéo Blade Carbon Ti 
  • Saddle: Prologo 
  • Sunglasses: Scicon
  • Tyres: Continental
  • Wheels: Enve

Uno-X

The Norwegian team are unchanged for 2024, and with some big names added to their men’s team expect them to be back at the Tour de France.

  • Bike: Dare MA-AFO, VSRu, TSRf (TT)
  • Bottles and bottle cages: Elite
  • Clothing: Bioracer
  • Computer: Garmin
  • Groupset: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2
  • Helmet: Sweet Protection
  • OSPW: CeramicSpeed
  • Saddle: Prologo
  • Shoes: Shimano
  • Sunglasses: Sweet Protection
  • Tyres: Schwalbe Pro One
  • Wheels: DT Swiss
  • Extras: WattShop aero accessories, CeramicSpeed OSPW

Visma-Lease a Bike

Despite the name change, Visma-Lease a Bike are largely the same, they’ve even kept the yellow. The most notable change is probably switching from Lazer to Giro helmets. Weird that they’re Garmin sponsored but using Wahoo Speedplay pedals.

  • Bike: Cervélo R5, S5, Caledonia, P5 
  • Bottle cage: Tacx 
  • Clothing: Agu
  • Computer: Garmin 
  • Groupset: SRAM Red eTap AXS  
  • Handlebar tape: Fizik 
  • Helmet: Giro
  • Pedals: Wahoo Speedplay
  • Power meter: Quarq
  • Saddle: Fizik 
  • Shoes: Nimbl
  • Sunglasses: Oakley
  • Tyres: Vittoria Corsa Pro
  • Wheels: Reserve

But what do the names mean? Check out our full breakdown of who the WorldTour team sponsors actually are

author: jrobinson
